content:
I think the Bengals' defense is going to have to be on point if they want to slow down the Chiefs' offense. They're going to need to get pressure on Mahomes and force him into some quick decisions. If they can do that, they might be able to limit the big plays and keep the game close.

It's also going to be important for the Bengals' offense to stay on the field and keep the Chiefs' offense off the field. If they can sustain some long drives and score some points, that'll put pressure on the Chiefs to keep up. Joe Burrow is going to have to be sharp and make some big throws, and the Bengals' running game is going to have to be effective.

What do you think about the Bengals' chances of pulling off the upset? Do you think they've got what it takes to take down the Chiefs?
